review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Never go backcountry in summer without it. When the wind stops and the bugs start biting, this light weight packable head net is a lifesaver.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It's a bug net. Works ok. Got caught on velcro anytime it was near. I feel like I've had better bug nets. I wasn't super impressed. It obscured vision a fair amount. It could use a tiny weight or something to keep it in place.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Going to try to keep those little guys out of my face

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It worked keeping the biting flies off of me while hiking. It takes a while to get use to the mesh in your face.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Awesome bug protection. Best bug head net I have ever used.
review.name: Sea to summit bug head net

review.reviewBody: Use a wide brimmed hat and or a button up shirt and you’ll have no problem staying sane in a bug filled environment. I’ve bought 6 regular and one Ultra-Fine mesh of this head net. What’s that tell you?
review.name: A great buy again item

review.reviewBody: Really disappointed in this jacket despite good reviews from external sites. From the moment I got it, it was not waterproof for even a slight drizzle. It wets through instantly. I tried washing it and re-treating it per OR's instructions, but it's still awful. Maybe ok as a windbreaker, but not worth that for the price. Really disappointing.
review.name: Wets through instantly, do not buy

review.reviewBody: Not waterproof at all, small for size & do not recommend. Kind of worthless after a year of wearing it.  Colors are good, and that's about it.
review.name: Don't waste your money

review.reviewBody: I remember when OR gear used to be absolutely bombproof -- I still have a pair of gators that I bought in the 90s! Sadly, those days are gone. Bought this jacket for a thru-hike on the Colorado Trail this past summer. It was brand new and completely failed in a torrential downpour; I got absolutely soaked, and if it had been much colder, it could have been a serious situation. I do a lot of thru-hiking and backcountry travel, and I need to be able to rely on my gear (especially when it's brand new.) I won't be buying technical gear from OR in the future. I guess this jacket is appropriate for... misty conditions? A short walk in light rain? A stroll down to the cafe? But don't trust if it you're really going to be out in the elements.
review.name: Failed in a storm

review.reviewBody:
I’ve been looking for a very packable rain jacket  to take on trips that are likely to have some rain but not much.  I wanted a jacket with no Velcro which is hard to find.  This jacket has none and is very lightweight so I decided to try it.  I am 5’2” about 118 pounds and ordered the small thinking that would allow for some light layers underneath.  The problem with this jacket and many others is they are cut so straight that there is little room in the hip area.  With even a light layer it was very tight in the hips when zipped up.  I wish outdoor clothing companies would realize that most women have hips!!  I ended up getting a medium which fits really well except for the sleeves being too long.  I can tuck them under.
Have not worn in rain yet but since I will only use for light rain I think it will be fine.
review.name: Nice But Narrow on Bottom

review.reviewBody: This jacket is not waterproof at all nor is it water resistant.
review.name: Not waterproof nor water resistant.

review.reviewBody: This is an excellent lightweight jacket to bring along in case of showers or an unexpected drop in temperatures. Packs very small. It is not intended as a true rain shell. Knowing that, it is an excellent gear addition.
review.name: Excellent lightweight jacket

review.reviewBody: I purchased this rain coat for a 16 day Grand Canyon rafting trip, going 226 miles through monsoon season and epic rapids. This coat is durable, compact and high quality rain jacket that is true to size. Highly recommended this rain coat, worth every penny
review.name: Perfect raincoat for intense rafting!

review.reviewBody: This jacket looks and feels nice but is more of a windbreaker than a rain jacket. It wets through after being in a light rain for more than a few minutes. I bought this jacket three years ago but haven't worn it much and the seam taping on both of the armpits is coming apart.
review.name: See below

review.reviewBody: Color & durability are so perfect!!!
review.name: Great quality!

review.reviewBody: This jacket has nearly zero waterproofing, with the arms of the jacket absorbing the rain immediately. It is very lightweight, but useless for anything other than throwing on to get out of your tent for a few minutes during rain.
review.name: Wet out after just 10 minutes in moderate rain

name: Helium Rain Jacket - Women's

description: Buy the Black Diamond Momentum Harness - Women's online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Momentum Harness - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Momentum Harness - Women's online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I'm newer to rock-climbing and wanted a simple but also high quality harness, this is exactly that. It's very comfortable and the colors are beautiful. It runs small so size up if you are one the edge.
review.name: Great Harness

review.reviewBody: Got this a couple weeks ago and it is incredibly comfortable and mobile. I’m a guy with a smaller waist but bigger legs so the women’s harness was a much better fit (I also liked the colors a bit more). Gear loops are sturdy and really nothing to complain about
review.name: Great, reliable harness

review.reviewBody: This is my first harness and I ordered it online. I was given a harness run down at my climbing gym before hand. I was wondering it was t gonna fit or line up but it fit perfectly and is super comfortable. Great harness
review.name: Beginner

review.reviewBody: The women’s harness I got works fine and is completely functional, but doesn’t fit quite right. For reference, I am a curvy woman with large hips and thighs but an average waist size. This harness is too big for me in the waist and slightly too small for me in the thighs. However, because of this I don’t think there is a size that will fit me correctly. Additionally, I wish the loop that connects the waist band to the leg hole was a little bit longer because I would like the harness to fit higher on my waist and lower on my thighs.
review.name: Harness fine but doesn’t fit a curvy body

review.reviewBody: The sizing info on your website is wayyy different from what I actually got. On here it says an XS is 66-74 cm but the actual harness’ tag says XS but 61-69 cm! It’s smaller than what the website says. This leaves me to cinch it super tight to have the belay loop in the middle and gear loops symmetrical. I’m only a beginner; I saved money for this and really spent a good amount of time figuring out the right size for me only to receive a product that doesn’t match your sizing chart.
review.name: sizing is inaccurate

review.reviewBody: Awesome harness, good price point, comfy, good fit and can rely on it to get the job done!
review.name: Super great beginner harness

review.reviewBody:
the color and waist fit are great!

the leg loops were slightly tight...wanted an adjustable and not sewned.
review.name: love the color

review.reviewBody: I was afraid about the size and thought it would not hace a good fit, either way it was like if it was practically made for me. It has a super nice fit in legs and waist perfect for rock or gym climbing
review.name: AM LOVING EVERY PIECE

review.reviewBody: I use this both for rock climbing and search and rescue and I really like it it folds up decently small and is super comfortable would definitely recommend
review.name: Great harness

review.reviewBody: I was super excited to go climbing but I the harness I got doesn’t align properly. I don’t know how to explain it but the gear loop and the leg elastics are uneven, you can only have one dead center. I can get both close to midpoint but only if I close it all the way and other there’s no way I’m fitting in there. I’ve just order a second one in a bigger size to see if that’s the issue, but I doubt it. I’ll update my review when I find the one that’s the proper fit. Memorial Day weekend ruined :(
review.name: I probably got a defective one

name: Momentum Harness - Women's

review.reviewBody: I have tried many options but for sure this open air are just in another level. Super super clear audio and good bass plus when doing call the other end gets to hear me very clearly. The ENC is superb. I love them
review.name: Perfect way of life with open ear

review.reviewBody: Comfortable to wear but I have difficulty in tapping the right spot to pause audio or end a call. I prefer the button on my OpenFits.
review.name: Comfortable to wear but I

review.reviewBody: The volume doesn’t get loud enough but I am only using one at a time but very different to hear extremely comfortable but if it went into my ear more it would be better.
review.name: The volume doesn’t get loud

review.reviewBody: She loves them. Love the fact they sit outside the ear, sound quality better than her i ones.
review.name: Gift for Daughter

review.reviewBody: I love the way the headphones fit, and how easy it is to still hear the environment around you. They’re easy to connect to my phone (iPhone) and the sound quality is great (I am not an audiophile- just an average listener). However, these things do NOT hold their charge. I had been using them, and then left them for a couple of days and then they were dead. When I had quit using them, the buds themselves and the case still had charge on them. However, opening them up after a few days and they were dead. My AirPods and other headphones I own can hold their charge even after a long time of not using so this is disappointing. Also, I’ve had these headphones for only a month!! This is disappointing and would get a higher rating if they could Hold their charge.
review.name: Great when they’re charged and ready… but they don’t hold their charge!

review.reviewBody: I thought this was bone conducting, not over the ear canal, this is not what I expected after owning the original aftershokz.
review.name: I thought this was bone

review.reviewBody: Decent fit, average sound, poor volume and controls are hard to find
review.name: Decent fit, average sound, poor

review.reviewBody: am still trying to adjust to the ear buds but they are not as easy to operate as the regular ones. While I love the no bar in the back, trying to answer a call is not that easy. Half the time I end up canceling the call. Very sensitive to touch or doesn't connect easily.
review.name: Not so great

review.reviewBody:
These are nice! They aren’t the most secure. I have lost one without realizing, but I noticed in time to retrace and find it. But I like wearing these more than any ear bud. 

The sound is very good from classical music to contemporary. I’m glad I made this decision!
review.name: They are great and I like them better than

review.reviewBody: Much more comfortable than ear pod type headphones
review.name: Much more comfortable than ear

name: OpenFit Headphones

review.reviewBody: Might be a function of my short legs & the XS size (5’3” 117lbs, mostly of butt-muscle), but the pockets were unusable for me. Nice thick fabric (not fleecy but substantial), great flattering fit on the legs & butt, and in front too, nice high waist, which made me sad to return these. 2 pockets at hip & 2 at sides of knee, all of them are smallish (won’t fit a big iPhone). If filled they would be uncomfortable, especially the knee ones as they are right at the bend in your leg, but the hip pockets also are too far to the front and would interfere with my hip flexing too. Definitely get these if you only need to put keys & credit card in the pockets, they are really nice! The blue color was really appealing too, very deep without quite being navy. I feel like I should give them 4 stars but the pockets upset me too much.
review.name: Great fit & fabric, misplaced pockets

name: Anelie Tight - Women's

hasVariant.name: Breeze Cropped Pant - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Free Fly Breeze Cropped Pant - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: These are my new favorite pants! They are super comfortable & look great.
review.name: Favorite new pants

review.reviewBody: I purchased an earlier version of the Breeze Cropped Pant and it did not have the extended waist band with the ties on the outside. The ties "disrupt" the line. I prefer the ties on the inside. If you can return these pant to that design that would be great. The zip back pockets should be mandatory on of these pant. I do not feel as if I might lose something from the back pocket.
review.name: Changes

review.reviewBody: Live these in black. Can dress them up with shoes or candles and a too and swwleater for going out.
review.name: My new go to pants

review.reviewBody: I am so glad I found these pants. Have 3 pair now! Incredibly comfortable, excellent fit, relaxed but classy looking.
review.name: My new go to pants

review.reviewBody: I wanted these to work. They're close to perfection, but they were too big around the waist for me. The sizing/proportions seemed off. But the color and material are perfect. Hopefully they'll fit other people better.
review.name: Comfy pants

review.reviewBody: These are super comfy and feel like they will last and not easily rip like other outdoorsy light weight pants. I am a bit short so they are more like ankle pants than crops though. Also since I am short the become more extra high rise at the waist.
review.name: Best pants!

review.reviewBody: I now have three pairs of the breeze cropped pants. I like them for multiple reasons:-soft, light, stretchy, easy-to-layer fabric-colors are rich and versatile-since I am short, the crop goes right to my ankle, which makes them ideal for different occasions and shoes-true to sizeThe only drawback is that they can get wrinkly if not hung up and the wrinkles are stubborn.
review.name: Best. Pants. Ever.

review.reviewBody: I already had these pants in 2 other colors and just felt like I needed at least one more pair! Seriously, though, these pants are true to size and are SO comfy! They have plenty of flex without stretching out while wearing all day! Definitely a must have in everyone’s closet
review.name: Best pants ever🙌

review.reviewBody: These are my new favorite pants! Super comfy, Lightweight, versatile for adventures, love the fit!
review.name: Favorite pants!

review.reviewBody: I love these pants so, so much! Super comfortable. Light weight. UPF sun protection. Quick drying. These are by far my favorite sun protective pants I've found so far. I will definitely be getting more in different colors.
review.name: Awesome Pants

name: Breeze Cropped Pant - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Alti II GORE-TEX Mitten online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
The Alti II blends comfort, durability, and functionality into a singular mitt. These kept me warm and protected with a liner glove while on a week-long mountaineering expedition. Warm and dry, they felt great and protected my hands and lower arms well. 

Anyone looking for a rugged winter glove for backcountry expeditions, from skiing to winter hiking or mountaineering objectives, I couldn’t recommend these more.
review.name: Comprehensive protection

review.reviewBody: 1st, they are cozy-comfy. No moment of chill putting them on, due to the soft lining. 2nd, even here in Madison, WI, I only need to use the inner insulating mitt under 10deg, and I have sensitive baby hands. 3rd, I preferred these because they don't use leather. Finally, I am NOT nice to them, and they've survived for 8 years (though the last 2 were pushing it for waterproofness and wind-blocking).
review.name: I CONSTANTLY recommend these mitts!

review.reviewBody: very warm, very bulky (as you would expect).  Great for adventures, hard to make practical when tooling around at the resort.

These will keep your hands from getting frost bite but I lose all feeling in my hands after a few hours outside. Not made for prolonged outdoor usage below 40 degrees. The synthetic fill liner loses all insulation after a season and needs to be replaced.
review.name: They prevent frost bite but don't keep you warm

review.reviewBody: Quite frankly the Best cold weather mitts/gloves/hand wear I have ever used. I have been searching for the elusive holy grail of hand wear as I suffer with the cold but I spend time in the cold. These mitts are just outstanding in EVERY WAY. Thank you
review.name: Brilliant

review.reviewBody: These mittens are unbelievably warm and good. They are durable, warm, and cozy. They have enough room inside the liner to toss in a hand warmer too. I used them in -5 F in a windy day (the coldest day of WA in a decade!) for ski touring. As a person that has 10+ pairs of gloves/mittens (in forever search for perfect gloves), and has suffered frostnibs before, I cannot recommend these more. The only problem is dexterity, which I had opted out the moment I chose mittens over gloves. I have Arete gloves for mountaineering, which are similar (but less warm) with more dexterity.
review.name: One of the warmest mittens

review.reviewBody: Starting out in grandpa's hunting and fishing camps in southern Louisiana, I have hiked, climbed, paddled...you name it, my entire life and all over the US and Canada. I bought these mittens to climb Kilimanjaro for my 65th birthday next year. Every pair of gloves I have ever bought were a size large and quite comfortable. According to OR's glove sizing chart for this mitten, I wear a size medium. I could barely get it on, and my thumb would only go about 85% into the thumb hole. I did previously purchase an OR waterproof liner glove in the near past. It too was a size large and likewise I could barely get it on. But since it is supposed to be a liner glove I didn't think too much of it. I might add that over the past half a century I have started boycotting Patagucci, The Lost Face, Rodent, etc. The last two companies I am willing to do business with is Outdoor Research and Mountain Hardwear. But the fact that I have to pay return shipping to return the Alti Mitts means that I will now restrict my outdoor clothing purchases to Mountain Hardwear.
review.name: Sized for miniature humanoids.

review.reviewBody: These mittens are not nearly as warm as all the hype says. The thin liners do not have very much insulation and are held in place by annoying Velcro. Yet the mittens overall seem very bulky and poor fitting. Supposedly you can also remove the liners to use separately but then the Velcro catches and damages everything it touches. Also the fabric is very thin so will tear. These mittens just aren't good, especially considering the ridiculously high cost.
review.name: Not That Warm, Odd Liner Fit

review.reviewBody: (This review was collected as part of a promotion.) I LOVE these mitts. These mitts came on a ski trip across Baffin Island with me and they did a great job keeping my hands warm. For an average day you can go without the liners. My only caution is that they fit small. I wear a ladies M in everything, but the men's alti II L feel like my original women's alti in S/M.
review.name: Love these mitts-but fit small.

review.reviewBody: I wore these mitts for an 8 day hut to hut ski trip in Finland north of the Arctic Circle. They were too warm. That is a great problem to have. I ended up just using he liner 95% of the time. In a wind storm I used the whole system and it was perfect.
review.name: These mitts are the best!

name: Alti II GORE-TEX Mitten

review.itemreviewed: Tabula Rasa Limited Edition Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: Jersey material is pilling shortly after use, only a couple of short rides, very disappointing.
review.name: Castelli Jersey review.

review.itemreviewed: Tabula Rasa Limited Edition Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: First off, I like this jersey because I have a belly and this fits. Many products are for people in much better shape and just don't fit me regardless of the size. The white, black and grey are BORING but I was not able to find good fit in more interesting jerseys. But, this think started having fuzzy pillage after the first ride just above the waist line for both side panels. Not sure what is up with the fabric on these panels as nothing else is doing this and I have a three year old Castelli jersey that is still in great shape.
review.name: Pillage on Sides

review.itemreviewed: Tabula Rasa Limited Edition Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: This review will be short and sweet with this one. I usually run a small in all my clothing(5'6'' 150lbs but a lean 150) and since the recommendation is to size up, I did just that. This jersey in a medium actually fits me better than another Castelli I bought a couple months back, which in this case is just a bit more snug, which is great. But usually what you end up with, at least in my case since I only have a very slight bit of pudge around my waist( I am 45 years old after all), is the jersey being a little more relaxed, which honestly is fine. What I love about this jersey is the design, the pockets are nice and roomy, zips up great, and feels extremely comfortable. I've only gone on one ride with this one, but based on this experience, this will be far from the last jersey I buy from Castelli!
review.name: Always size up with Castelli

review.itemreviewed: Tabula Rasa Limited Edition Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have a number of Castelli bike cloths.  They all seem to be very tight on me but this particular shirt while marked XL seemed like it was barely a medium.  I notice some other reviews have them running large.  It is always a gamble buying Castelli because their sizing is all over the place.  Too bad because they seem to be manufactured rather well.  If they could get there sizing more consistent they would be my go to bike clothing.
review.name: This one ran extremely small

review.itemreviewed: Tabula Rasa Limited Edition Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: So small. I bought a large for my husband, who is usually a medium. He could still barely get this on. Disappointed.
review.name: Small

review.itemreviewed: Tabula Rasa Limited Edition Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: size chart XXL for 43.3 inch chest. I have a 44 inch chest and XXL is very loose. i have to return it for XL. Normally Castelli runs very small but not with this model jersey, actually quite the oposite.
review.name: XXL runs large

review.itemreviewed: Tabula Rasa Limited Edition Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: Purchased both short sleeve and long sleeve Castelli jerseys in XXL.  5'11" 205 lbs.  Long sleeve fit, short sleeve too tight.  returning short sleeve and ordering larger size.  Long sleeve jersey excellent for weather down to 50 degrees.
review.name: Sizing

name: Tabula Rasa Limited Edition Jersey - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I excitedly opened the box and was impressed by the design and construction of the pack. Unfortunately, after wearing the pack for a few minutes with only 20lbs, it became clear that the pack would not work for me. The curved frame dug into my back. 

If the curve of your back does not match the curve of the plastic frame, this pack won't work for you. Other packs have metal stays that can be customized or don't contact your back directly. Not so with this pack's central pre-formed plastic support. 

Fortunately, Backcountry has a great return policy.
review.name: Curved plastic frame not for everyone

name: Blaze 60L Backpack - Women's

review.reviewBody: This is my 3rd pair; I re-buy them every year. They are surprisingly warm for thin gloves. I can walk my dogs, push a stroller, and use my phone with no issues!
review.name: Great, thin gloves

review.reviewBody: feels good, thickness is good, overall length is good too BUT, palm width is for adults, finger is for kids so out of my hand shape returning
review.name: very short finger

review.reviewBody: The gloves seem nice but are totally inconsistent In sizing compared to other gloves. I bought these and the women's vigor lightweight gloves for Christmas and these are about half an inch shorter in the fingers and don't stress very much so not worth the purchase. I imagine the larger size would have the hand part so big it wouldn't be secure. The ratio for sizing is just super odd.
review.name: Fingers are so short and not true to size

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Work well. Actually do work with the phone. Nice snug fit for good dexterity. Not too hot. Easy to pull off and on.
review.name: Great for spring skiing, summer hiking

review.reviewBody: I purchased several pairs of melody gloves a couple years back. They were fantastic and I loved them. Decided to grab another pair and am very disappointed in how poor the quality is now. They're now a different type of fabric and are no longer "buttery soft." The fit is now terrible. The length of the fingers is too short and the pinkie doesn't even cover two knuckles. Definitely not what they used to be. Not even worth returning given the return shipping fee. So I'll donate them and perhaps a child with tiny fingers can make use of them
review.name: Not what they used to be

review.reviewBody: I initially bought the small and found the fingers to be very short. The glove did not reach the crotch of fingers. So I returned them and went up a size and still had the same issue but now the glove was loose around my hand. I don't think I have especially long fingers either... Sadly had to return the medium as well. Otherwise I think the gloves would have been great!
review.name: Very short fingers

review.reviewBody: I ordered these hoping they'd be enough to wear as solo gloves or camping gloves but they're a bit too thin for my taste. Then again, my hands are colder than most folks' hands! The green was also brighter than expected... Loved the touchscreen fingers though.
review.name: Lovely, but not warm enough for me

review.reviewBody: Light weight, dry out very quickly if they get wet. Works great with touch screen.
review.name: Great!

review.reviewBody: Best gloves you can buy! Warm while still allowing dexterity. The phone sensors work well too. I also love that they cover the wrists. Great gloves!
review.name: The only gloves I wear

review.reviewBody: My second pair, I used the first one for at least 5 or 6 years. Perfect for light gloves for warm days (spring, fall, or winter sometimes), and also as a layer under mittens. I plan to buy those gloves every time I need to change them, until the end of my life.
review.name: Best light gloves

name: Melody Sensor Glove - Women's

review.reviewBody:
Great bike overall, good power, fairly quiet, and the front suspension helps with the shocks.

Found one major flaw today in the chain guard design.  You cannot remove the chain guard without removing the pedal / crank.  The chain slipped off today which should be a 10 second fix, and now I've got to go buy some new tools.  Thankfully I was near home when it happened.

Customer support was very nice and understanding, and said that the chain should not slip off.  This is a major design flaw, and should be fixed.

review.itemreviewed: Lofoten GORE-TEX PRO Anorak Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have been on the hunt for a long ski jacket and this is almost perfect. I am between sizes and sized down which feels pretty good but a bit tight in the seat when I sit down, so ladies who are a bit more bottom heavy or snowboarders who need a wider stance might size up. I was considering paring it with the primaloft anorak for very cold days but not sure there will be space for another long jacket. Overall excellent jacket I can use year round and although it takes a bit of strategy to get in and out its not that difficult. My main complaint is with backcountry.com and that it didn't come with the powder skirt! Is this a big deal? Not really. I bought it on clearance and considering the length of the jacket and fact I wear bibs it will need to be very rowdy to get snow in my pants but still, even with the clearance pricing this is still a spendy piece of kit to be missing a component.
review.name: Nice jacket, missing pwd skirt

review.itemreviewed: Lofoten GORE-TEX PRO Anorak Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I’ve had my eye on this jacket since last ski season and finally bought. Quality is awesome, I can tell this will be a durable jacket for backcountry and resort riding. All the pockets are really well designed. The hood fits and zips over my helmet. It is really long, which I like but might not be for everyone. As the description says it is designed as a relaxed fit, so in my case I didn’t need to size up. The half zip is kind of a different design for getting in and out, but because both sides unzip all the way up, it’s easy to get on and off. Might be annoying for going to the bathroom with my bibs, but I’m sure I’ll figure it out. 

I ordered both M and S because I like a looser fit, but ended up  keeping the S. I’m 5’4”, 125lbs (petite on top, thick on bottom) for reference. 

Can’t wait to to put her to use this winter!
review.name: Relaxed fit quality is great!

review.itemreviewed: Lofoten GORE-TEX PRO Anorak Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I’ve been searching for a Gortex jacked that can essentially be used year round, from my board to my hiking boots. I searched everywhere on which size to purchase and teetered between a small and a medium. I’m 5’8”, 130lbs, athletic build, few curves. Directionally I was pointed at a medium, but I didn’t want it to look puffy. I opted for the small and am glad I did. As other reviews stated, it is a little funky to get on. I have to unzip the sides to get it on. I’m not sure if this is the size issue or a design issue. Once on, the jacked looks great. I can wear my normal snowboard gear underneath and a puffy or a sweatshirt. I’m glad I didn’t go for the medium. I don’t feel restricted in the jacket and I ride rough. I hope this helps anyone trying to figure out a size. I ordered the blue, it’s beautiful! Pockets and quality are sick! Highly recommend this brand and its goal of being more eco friendly. This jacket will last, so it’s worth the price. I plan on taking it to Iceland in June.
review.name: Picked the right size

name: Lofoten GORE-TEX PRO Anorak Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: I've been using these for a few seasons. I love them. I have the front points as well. I do not use those very often, but the sender plates are a must. The pack easy. either in your pack or on the outside. Super light. Durable. When the snow gets firm, watch your friends ask you to kick the booter in. Oh' some rock you have to stand on, no worries, you won't slip like in verts. Don't get me wrong, verts are rad for deep pow booting. These can do that, maybe not as well, but they do everything else better.

description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Dragonfly 3-Person Footprint online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Dragonfly 3-Person Footprint
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Dragonfly 3-Person Footprint online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Fits my Dragonfly OSMO 3P perfectly! Great for preventing damage to your tent.
review.name: Works perfectly!

review.reviewBody: I bought this footprint to go with the Dragonfly 3P tent. The material seems good and the color coding is nice. The reason I am only giving it 3 stars is that unless you stake this tent out, the footprint attaches very loosely and just flops under the tent. For the price of this footprint and the price of the tent, I would expect something better. The reason I bought a supposedly freestanding tent is so that I could sleep in it without the fly or staking it out when the weather is nice. I can still do that, but because the footprint is so loose underneath, the sides and the edges of the tent get exposed to dirt and possible abrasion. Seems to negate the value of a footprint and I really don’t understand the logic behind this one design detail.
review.name: Disappointing design flaw with the attachment meth
comment: We appreciate the feedback and will take it into consideration for future product improvements. If you have any further questions or need assistance, please don't hesitate to contact our customer support team.

review.reviewBody: My husband normally wears an extra large, and he couldn't even get the leg past his knee, it was so small. We thus returned it.
review.name: The extra large was extra small!

review.reviewBody: Long time Red Wing wearer and these are great. I had to size 1/2 down from my usual Red Wing size. I wear 9.5 in the work chukka, postman, everything, but these were too long so I had to return for a size 9. Hope that is helpful for yall. The foot bed is extremely comfortable out of the box. Classic Red Wing quality, feel like they will last a long time.
review.name: Good boots

review.reviewBody: Got these as an early Christmas gift from my parents. They were a little snug at first (as they should be for anyone buying online) but after a long day of use they were super comfortable. I have some experience with Red Wings, I own the Iron Ranger and the Classis Moc. Out of those 3 the Classic Chelsea has been the easiest to break-in. The build quality is good.
review.name: Easy to Break-In

review.reviewBody:
Bought these boots originally about a month ago. I have a pair of boots from a PNW boot maker that I love, but needed a Chelsea style boot for a work situation where I would need to take my shoes off and put them back on multiple times per day. That boot maker doesn't make a Chelsea, so I went looking elsewhere. I hadn't tried any Red Wing heritage products before, but had heard that people love the Iron Rangers and Moc Toe boots so I decided to give these a try since they seemed close to the type of boots I had come to like. Boy, was I wrong.

I was confused when I first put the boots on. The foam insoles were topped with leather which was... odd for a heritage boot. I figured it was maybe to make the boots more approachable by adding some under-foot comfort and who doesn't like that? 

Once I got the boots home, I realized that the pair I was sold was actually two different sizes in the same box. The store claimed they were like that from the factory and seemed to struggle to figure out what to do about this. No big deal - they figured out they'd order me a new pair. That's fine. Except that it wasn't. 

The new pair I had received (and already paid for) had some obviously wacky stitching in the welt around the big toe on the right boot. Just cosmetic, I figured. But a defect nonetheless. 

So I wore them for a couple days until the boots tried to eat a hole through the back of my heel. I reached a hand in  to make sure there was no debris or anything that would be making this happen only to find the debris was actually a piece of the boot. There's a sharp piece of plastic Red Wing is trying to pass off as a heel counter covered by the world's thinnest leather liner. That vicious heel counter feels like it's covered with a paper thin layer of leather. 

As I explored the boot, I realized the leather liner stops and becomes... synthetic something? I don't know what the toe liner material is. 

It would be possible to let any of these individual transgressions against the boot gods slide, but once those plastic heel counters announced themselves too loudly to ignore, it brings all the elements into focus in a way that makes me regret I bought these.

For the price, I'd expect a heritage boot. Is Red Wing's heritage building boots with plastic parts? The thinnest possible linings? Switching to synthetic materials in places they don't expect people to look? Misplacing stitches with no apparent quality control? If so, Red Wing's heritage doesn't deserve to be carried on any further and definitely doesn't deserve another dollar of mine or yours.

I added a star because the boots almost look nice (except for the wonky stitching) and the upper leather appears to be of decent quality.
review.name: Overpriced, Poor Quality
comment: Thank you for your review. We are sorry that our boots did not live up to your expectations. We stand behind our products with an industry-leading warranty. We will contact you directly to discuss your options!

review.reviewBody: I love the feel. Can wear them all day. The soles are relatively flat so no debris gets stuck. They are a bit difficult to get on at first but they do loosen up.
review.name: Comfortable as heck
comment: I'm so glad you've had lasting comfort with these. I hope we can continue to serve you in the future!

review.reviewBody:
I’ve owned these boots for 3 years now. For reference, I wear them about 6 months out of the year and a couple times throughout the summer time. 

Let me start by saying there really isn’t a “break in” period with these. Right out of the box, they are very comfortable. As you wear them, they obviously will mold to your foot bed. 

The quality is 8.7 out of 10. The elastic is starting to get pretty stretched out. The leather itself is awesome if you take care of it. 

Overall, I highly suggest buying this boot! Whether it’s dress up or just going to the store, these are perfect to slip on and go.
review.name: Review after 3 years
comment: Thank you for your review! We are glad to hear we have lived up to your expectations. We hope that you continue to have lasting comfort with these. We can't wait to see you again!

review.reviewBody: Please makes size 7EE. I love this boots but been waiting for size 7EE
review.name: Size 7 EE
comment: Thank you for your feedback! We're so glad to hear that you love the boots. We will pass this along to product development for further sizing opportunities!

review.reviewBody: So I bought these boot when they came out. Was super excited about an all black pair of red wing heritage boot. The boots all around look amazing. However I must gotten a bad boot…I understand the whole break in process and there a bit hard on your feet the first few wears. For whatever reason it’s been over a year and my right boot kills the ball of my inner heel. This isn’t my first pair of red wings. So it’s strange to me that this is happening. I really just figured it was part of the break in process. But once I really looked at the boot and started checking…it feels like the heel part of the boot is bumpy and hard in some spots. My left boot on the other hand feels amazing. Broke in nicely and I could wear them all day. For the record I was wearing these boots about 3-4 times a week for work. So about 8-10 hours of use per day. So they were “broken in”. Obviously it’s been too long and I can’t exchange them or return them. So now they’re just sitting in my closet.
review.name: Painful Boot
comment: Thank you for your review! We are sorry to hear about the lack of comfort you've received in your boots. We will contact you directly to discuss your options!

review.reviewBody:
I've owned a few Chelsea style boots for work: blundstones and redbacks as well. I would go through 1 pair per year. Nothing compares to the leather and build qualities to Redwings. 

These are now my 4th pair of Redwings from the Heritage series and would highly recommend them.
review.name: Great boots!

review.reviewBody: Great boots, I went down a full size from my typical shoe/brannock size. The fit is great for me. I think these are well made and should last quite awhile. I am wearing these casually, I got the black harness leather and I like the black wedge soles, I’d like to see those as an option on more boots! Overall I am impressed as usual with Redwing heritage. Thank you.
review.name: Best Chelsea Boots I’ve owned
comment: Thank you for your review! We are glad to hear that your boots are working well for you

review.reviewBody: Great shoe.  Fits well.  Tight to get my foot into through the stretch gussets but then when my foot is inside the shoe is bigger than my regular size 12.  Should have sized down to a 11 1/2.
review.name: Very comfortable but runs big
comment: Thank you for your review! We are glad to hear that your boots are working well for you. It is true, they do run big. We hope to continue to serve you in the future!

review.reviewBody:
Super comfy, just the right length! Now I just need a few more pairs in other colors. 
👍🏼🌈😎
review.name: My new favorite shorts ever!

review.reviewBody: Kuhl shorts are my go-to. They're built strong and last. Happy to have found them on sale at Backcountry!
review.name: Industry Standard

review.reviewBody:
I have a mix of Renegade pants, purchased over the past couple of years. My main reason for purchasing is I run my dogs in agility.  My dogs are fast!  I have to push hard to stay connected over a 30 second run time. These pants are light weight, and loose enough, to support that.

Renegades are used on 10 mile bicycle rides to keep me in shape for the dogs.  I also wear them to work, and out to dinner regularly. Love them!

So why not a five star rating?  Two things:
1)  I am not happy buying expensive product that is guaranteed to fade.  To Kuhl's credit, they at least tell you in product description!  Fading with older pairs is minor at this point.

2) Stains.  I avoid lighter colors as they are more likely to show stains, which I have not been able to remove. 

My pants wardrobe is somewhere near 50% Kuhl, so they seem to work out in general.  :)
review.name: Renegade: A consistent product line.

review.reviewBody: Zippered thigh pockets are nicely positioned and very useful but I'd love to see a zippered pocket inside the hand pockets. I have another pair of shorts from a different brand the has a double hand pockets on one side that is zippered and large enough to hold a phone and small billfold. Great for travelling and browsing in crowded markets, etc.
review.name: Most of the features I'd really like

review.reviewBody: No wrinkles, water and dirt just brush off. Nice and cool too
review.name: Good shorts

review.reviewBody: Love these shorts. Comfortable and great when you plan to get wet. Sturdy yet light.
review.name: Great all around

review.reviewBody: I like these shorts, the length, the cut, the material.  However, just a small bit of pressure on the waist and the button comes undone.   It's super annoying and if I didn't wear a belt, would be embarrassing.
review.name: Nice shorts, except the button

review.reviewBody: Perfect fit, and with all the necessary pockets.

review.reviewBody: This shoe is a win for gravel riding. Since 2016, I've tried about 5 shoes for gravel. These stand out as the best. Riding a long hard pack rough and bumpy section, I realized that my feet where not absorbing all the rough bumps, not at all. Usually, the harshness of the ride transfers to my feet. With these, I had no pain at all. These shoes are heavy. The soles are not stiff but not soft either. They do a fantastic job at keeping the rider comfy. No foot pain at end of ride.  Very happy. W size 9, EU size 41 works.
review.name: Great gravel shoe

review.reviewBody: These were one of two pants I brought with me on a 40-mile through hike in Alaska. They’re comfortable but the sizing is strange - the crotch is very long. The extra high waist made my pack clips around the hips more comfortable though. Primary complaint is that the cuffs don’t actually cuff to convert into joggers.
review.name: No jogger conversion

review.reviewBody: These pants are very comfy and the color is so cute. But the fit is very odd, at least on me. The crotch is sooo long. Just looks so weird. And I like to wear my pants high so it’s still long even with pants to my bellybutton. I am keeping them because they are comfy and they will work well for hiking.
review.name: Five stars for comfort 2 stars for style

review.reviewBody: So so so so comfortable. Thicker and stretchy-er than your average everyday pants and just as warm as jeans with so much more flexibility. Seemingly water repellent but wouldn't test it. GF loves them and been thinking of stealing for myself. Perfect everyday pants, festivals or when your back at camp and want to be comphy.
review.name: So Comfortable!

review.reviewBody: I tried these on and loved everything about them, except the color options!! I don't need another pair of black pants and all the other colors don't match anything I wear. These fit perfectly for a wide thigh, long torso girlie which is so rare so I'm a little disappointed with the lack of colors. I would buy asap if these came in a burnt/rust orange, navy, or a cream color.
review.name: More colors please!!

review.reviewBody: I like these pants. However, I decided to return them because the fabric is kinda heavy for hiking use. Also, I wish there were a deeper, zipper pocket or a cargo pocket, big enough for today's big smartphones. The sizing is right, because I am 160cm tall (L large). Also, I wish that the DWR is non-toxic.
review.name: Almost kept them

review.reviewBody: The product is so nice but the waist is too high or crotch is too low. The legs are also pretty baggy.  Really wish they fit me cause they’re such nice pants. Maybe they just need to make petite sizing
review.name: Sizing issues

review.reviewBody:
I bought these pants last year and LOVE them so much that I bought them in Lavendar Gray, bc duh it's the cutest color ever!! These pants are so comfy and fit so well, they have just enough stretch in them and are a great length for my 5'9" height (they hit just above the ankles on me which I love). I didn't realize these had DWR until I was camping and spilled water all over myself and it BRUSHED RIGHT OFF! 

I highly recommend these pants for everyday wear - I wear the black pair to the office regularly bc they feel like sneaky leggings but I still look pulled together. Next up on my list is the Chipmunk color!!
review.name: Go To Pants

name: Wander Pant - Women's

description: Buy the Petzl Ange Finesse Quickdraw online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Ange Finesse Quickdraw
hasVariant.description: Buy the Petzl Ange Finesse Quickdraw online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I've been climbing a decade and these are my least favorite quick draws of all time. It's the biner that ruins it. The gates feel flimsy and unwieldy while unclipping. Another big issue is that the shape of these wire gates is known to because easier caught on the dog bone. For example, when leading above your clip, the rope lifts and rotates dog bone causing it to ride up from the basket of the carabiner until it ends up on or above the wire gate. Now if you fall, the dog bone runs the risk of getting caught on the gate's black plastic instead of falling back into the basket of the carabiner. The result is that your dog bone side loads ONLY the gate of the carabiner and of course your protection fails.
review.name: They suck

name: Ange Finesse Quickdraw

The material isn't very comfortable, so I really haven't lived in them yet. I'm sure they'll soften up by the end of the summer. But right now wearing them is more about breaking them and less about a comfortable pair of shorts. I used to really love Kavu, but I'm not that stoked about these, yet.
review.name: Pretty Ok

review.reviewBody: These are going to be your STURDY pair of shorts not your comfortable ones. Not recommended if you are someone whose weight fluctuates. Just fit on legs, butt, and waist, for me but If I had sized up to a medium it would have looked oversized and sloppy. Unfortunately returned.
review.name: Stiff and unforgiving material

name: Patcho Short - Women's

description: Buy the Black Diamond Guide Ski Glove - Women's online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Guide Ski Glove - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Guide Ski Glove - Women's online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought these gloves for a trip to climb Mount Rainier. I have Raynauds and keeping my hands warm was a serious concern for me. These gloves kept my fingers warm and dry on the upper mountain. I’m so glad I bought them!
review.name: Worth EVERY penny!

review.reviewBody: These are really fabulous gloves. Upgraded materials In my humble opinion from the 2019 version I still have. BUT there is definitely a fit issue with the fingers being VERY short. And I have pretty short/wide hands for my size. Grandoe & Swany fit pretty well. Hestra--not (for very long fingers!). What I discovered after seeing the reviews about fit after receiving my pair is that it's the glove LINER that is miss-placed. The velcro inside the gauntlet is stitched in too high up and holds the liner higher up than needed/designed. The outer glove is fine. By pulling on the gauntlet and having the velcro release I found they fit OK. I will have the liner just barely attached at the bottom of the velcro strip. Or not at all. And then it works. Too much hassle to return/figure men's glove sizing. Or take the velcro out and resew lower down (maybe over the summer). My older pair gave me the hint that the M is my correct size. Hope customer service reads this review from a Pro to resolve this productionissue.
review.name: Great gloves. A fit issue resolved (by me)

review.reviewBody: These are very warm but still plenty of dexterity to hold an ice axe or other tools.
review.name: Cozy!

review.reviewBody: Purchased two pairs of Guide gloves. One for myself and one for my daughter. She has very sensitive skin and the wool blend fleece in the liner bothered her. It doesn't bother me in mine so I only note this in case anyone has similar sensitivities. Gloves otherwise are 5* still.
review.name: Great gloves but didn't work for daughter with wool liner.

review.reviewBody: love these gloves for guiding so much. Warm, but dexterity.
review.name: LOVE

review.reviewBody: The inside of the glove is very soft and they’re overall very warm (I have pretty severe Raynauds so I can only wear gloves down to 15 degrees Fahrenheit or so, after which I need mittens, but it was 30 prior to these!). I’m looking forward to testing them out climbing in Ecuador in a couple of months (main reason for purchase)!
review.name: Great fit, warmest gloves

review.reviewBody:
The fingers in the gloves are too short and too tight for the size
I am in Zermatt Switzerland this week and truthfully if I didn’t have hand warmers they wouldn’t be warm enough
review.name: Guide gloves

review.reviewBody: I was super excited to get this pair of gloves and waxed them up as instructed, ready for the incredible Utah ski resorts this winter. However, to my surprise, my fingers were extremely cold, requiring frequent breaks in the lodge to warm them up. Unfortunately, I will have to look for other alternatives.
review.name: Not warm

review.reviewBody: I only wish they had this color in men’s. I wear a men’s medium/large. I’m right in between the two. I bought the women’s medium, and it fits fine, nice and snug but not too much.
review.name: Love these gloves! So warm and durable.

name: Guide Ski Glove - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Tecnica Zero G Peak Boot - 2025 online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
You honestly can't believe how light these boots are. And the flex is unbelievable. When walking around they feel like slightly rigid hiking boots. The ease of buckling in is a wonderful asset in the backcountry. The hike mode on these is also so easy its crazy. They fit slightly more snugly than Cochise. The next size up was too big, so I'm just working them in and they'll be fine. Structurally, they aren't lift service boots, but for a backcountry dedicated boot they are excellent. Most rigid fully backcountry boot I've seen. Don't compare these to a front-country boot or even a hybrid. But for a dedicated touring boot, they perform wonderfully on the way down. 
I saw one video where they say that they are hard to get into. Not in my experience at all. My foot pops right in. 
Note that these are about 18mm shorter than other Technica boots of the same foot size. So you'll likely have to redrill your bindings. I had plenty of space to do that, but if you've already drilled your skis twice, you might want to consider that. 
I have Voile V6 BC with Fritschi Tecton bindings. With these boots, it's the absolute dream setup for Vermont's rolling hills and long up and downy Green mountain tours.
review.name: Unbelievably Light and Rigid

name: Zero G Peak Boot - 2025

review.reviewBody: Great river shoe.  I also have the older Loyak and it gets filled with pebbles.   The new version is much better, maybe a little sand gets in.  The traction is very good.
review.name: Great river shoe

review.reviewBody: I am really pleased with these water shoes. They perform well and look great.
review.name: Attractive, functional

review.reviewBody: Comfy shoe I like it more words because I need 50!
review.name: Comfy

review.reviewBody: Great in the water, the drain holes keep up with the flow even while swimming, well done
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody: I've had the Loyak AC's for 4 months now and have been blown away by these shoes. Super light, fast draining, very comfortable, extremely grippy and shed moisture quickly when not being used. I use them primarily for sailing and have been thoroughly impressed.
review.name: Tried and True, these are amazing

review.reviewBody: As a barefoot shoe, I found them a bit tight, and probably should have gone up 1/2 size.
review.name: Sized snug

review.reviewBody: Pretty solid water shoe. Prevents the rocks from getting caught inside and under the foot. Wouldn't mind a bit more traction on the soles, but overall, did what I needed them to do. Very breathable and quick drying. Would recommend for days at the lake or river.
review.name: Overall great water shoe

review.reviewBody: These are amazing. I got them for every day where travel and for a trip to a sunny place that performed well and all regards I wore them all day in a water environment. My feet felt great. They had good grip. They drained and dried very fast. they still look brand new even though I’ve been wearing them in and out of the water and every day for the past few weeks
review.name: Amazing shoes

review.reviewBody: These are the best barefoot shoes on the market. I tried multiple much bigger/more expensive brands and ended up returning them. I am a full time fishing guide and when it’s too cold to be barefoot or my feet have gotten too much sun, these are the only shoes I wear on the boat and around town for that matter.
review.name: Best barefooters out there

review.reviewBody: Love the shoe for days on the water. Super fast drying and a perfect grip.
review.name: For endless days on the water

name: Loyak AC Water Shoe - Men's

The mediums feel perfect around the legs.  The waist may be just slightly too big if my weight dips a few lbs but living in Texas once I start sweating they are perfect with zero feeling as if the waist is sliding down in the back.

review.itemreviewed: Queens High Cut Brief Underwear - Women's
review.reviewBody: These briefs are perfect for older women who don't want elastic binding their lower abdomen. The waist-high elastic is wide, perhaps 2 inches. I only wear merino briefs and I haven't found another product on the merino market that comes close to these!! I highly recommend and hope to see more colors in the future!
review.name: A GREAT PRODUCT FOR OLDER WOMEN

review.itemreviewed: Queens High Cut Brief Underwear - Women's
review.reviewBody: I use it as underwear and am excited about wearing it on a multi-day trek with swimming opportunities where I'll wear it as my bottoms. It won't be see-through when wet and should dry quickly. I am a bit worried that it will grow in size while wet but will be worth trying. I bought a discontinued color (burgundy?) and wish I could have gotten a matching color Siren padded bra. AND I wish it either didn't have a white logo or that it had the logo on the back, just under the waist band or on the band. (Be sure to wash it separately at first to remove the excess color.) It does look huge out of the package, but try it on. The high cut leg is flattering and the high waist means no muffin top which I prefer. I am averaged sized but definitely have a butt.
review.name: Love mine and will buy a second if they go on sale.

review.itemreviewed: Queens High Cut Brief Underwear - Women's
review.reviewBody:
merino is amazing - especially for travel or exercise
I love the cut but wish they weren't *quite* so high waisted 
they are very comfortable 
runs a bit big on me but I'm not sure a size down would be right (might be too small)
review.name: love merino products

review.itemreviewed: Queens High Cut Brief Underwear - Women's
review.reviewBody: Oh so comfy! I love, love my Icebreaker Merino High Cut Brief. They come up to my waist, so covering my 71 year old little tummy. Makes for a more flattering as well as comfortable fit. In addition, they are so, so easy to wash. Hand wash, roll in a towel to remove excess water, hang to dry overnight, and back onto my body in the morning. so, so easy....
review.name: My favourite undies!!!

name: Queens High Cut Brief Underwear - Women's

review.reviewBody: This is my fourth pair of Ra's. Up until now I had only purchased the men's Version, but I'm quickly falling even more in love with the women's than I did the men's. Please note the sizing is all in men's so be sure to check out the sizing chart before ordering.
review.name: Best all around climbing shoes

review.reviewBody:
I agree with the other reviewer that this is very misleading. This is a women's shoe, the URL states so, the description states so, and despite the picture on the website, the shoe received says RA Women, not RA LV. I assume Tenaya at one point replaced "Woman" with "LV" so men could also wear this shoe but still trying to get rid of the old stock first? (my guess)

The problem is that the shoe size is listed in Men's not Women's. I knew I wanted the shoe, I knew what size I wanted, yet because of this, ordered an incorrect size and now I need to return which makes this so inconvenient because I don't have a Backcountry anywhere near me and need to pay to return it back. My size is also not in stock for an exchange.

Shoe itself is great, no complaints. Fits *my* foot beautifully, top padding is not bulky like another I tried on and comfy. Maybe it's the banana boots I've put in but so far this doesn't smell like my old shoes. I'd gladly repurchase when these wear out. I indoor boulder exclusively. Size is true to size too. I wear 6 in non-sneakers (heels etc) and these fit perfect in WOMEN'S size 6.
review.name: CAUTION SIZING -- MEN/WOMEN

review.reviewBody: I wore a hole through a previous pair and was repurchasing, so obviously I like this shoe. But backcountry messed up the sizing. It’s a women’s shoe so I ordered a size 8, received a men’s size 8 womens size 9. I now see in the fine print that it’s listed in men’s sizing, but why would you do that? Women’s shoes should be listed in women’s sizing. Do better.
review.name: Wrong sizing backcountry

name: Ra LV Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody: I take it everywhere for coffee, dried foods, etc.
review.name: Versatile

review.reviewBody: Jet boil is great product. I primarily use mine for hunting season in the Rocky Mountains. Having the ability to do a french press is great. Very portable.

I love the coffee press being incorporated into the jet boil pot.  Reducing the carry load is always helpful. I haven't yet used it at altitude but I expect typical jet boil performance. I would prefer a different design on the plunger, since I've lost half of it on a recent trip. It's a great option for any skill level.
Proven system with the addition of the coffee press makes this a great option for backpacking and any backcountry adventure.
review.name: Jetboil - Flash Java Kit

review.reviewBody: This is an excellent personal camp stove. Makes coffee in minutes, boils water for soup or pasta. Packs into itself including the gas can. Great product and super efficient.
review.name: Great camp stove!

review.reviewBody: Not a coffee drinker but my wife is, so I used this excuse to get a new Jetboil. I have a Jetboil that is about 15 years old, when I ran them side by side this boiled water in about half the time, that actually works well if your making 2 cups, gives you time to prepare the first one about the time the second one starts boiling. My wife describes the coffee as silky and loves it, as someone that does not know anything about coffee, this makes it easy for me. She grinds the coffee before we go camping, I boil water, add the coffee and wait around 5 min and then press and poor.
review.name: Happy wife, happy life!

review.reviewBody: boils water super duper fast, haven't found a use for the silly bottom cup tho
Love the quick boil! The plastic lid gets really hot when trying to pour but works as advertised.
So nice to have.  Quality, easy to use, and well engineered. This will get used a lot more than I anticipated.
review.name: Excellent!

review.reviewBody: Excellent kit gets that water hot fast!! I use this primarily to heat my water for tea in the early morning while im still in my camper. Works great very stable
review.name: Used for last two weeks on a trip

name: Flash Java Kit

review.reviewBody:
When I received the Ridge binding I was immediately impressed with how intuitive and simple the design was. I had some initial skepticism regarding the "wing" mechanism to release the heel unit, but after touring in these multiple times I wish this feature was spread across other bindings. No more heel pieces snapping around on cold fingers and the struggle to rotate my heel is non-existent. The preloaded risers have a huge impact on convenience too. Previously I was someone who never touched risers due to the time and difficulty in setting them up. I like to stay on the move and hate stooping over to adjust my heels. Now, I can simply flick them with my pole and keep cruising.

Moving onto the toe, you can literally step in blind. It's honestly harder to miss your pins than it is to hit them. Just swing your boot towards the toe bumper and you'll be in. I took these for a test day in the resort and after a few missed turns (my fault) on some bumps it was a breeze to step back in and keep moving.

Overall, this is a perfect daily driver binding that will serve any level of ski tourer very well!
review.name: Simple, Smart, Sturdy

name: Ridge Binding

review.itemreviewed: Divide 5 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
Divide 5 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] First things first. The shoes are highly comfortable, and I love them. Below, my evaluations are provided for both great stuff and somethings things I find could be better. 

Fit and Feel: These shoes tend to run slightly small (only slightly, on the right leg, with toe- that's just it. otherwise, fit well), but overall, they fit well once adjusted. During runs, I occasionally felt my right toe touching the inside layer, which required some attention to ensure comfort. The cushioning is excellent, providing great support especially when lifting weights. They felt fantastic during gym sessions, and the cushioning made running on the treadmill and walking on hard surfaces much more comfortable.

Design: The design is appealing, although they appear bulkier than they actually feel. The shoes are well-designed for aeration, allowing for good airflow to keep your feet cool during intense workouts.

Fabric: The fabric used is generally satisfactory. However, I wasn't particularly fond of the shoelaces—they have a plastic-like feel when tying, which detracts from the overall comfort.

What I Liked Most & What I Would Change: The standout feature for me is the cushioning; it genuinely made walking and exercising easier on my ankles, hindfoot/heel, and joints. If I could make improvements, I would opt for better-quality laces and incorporate more reflective material to enhance safety during nighttime runs or walks.

Overall Impression: These shoes offer excellent comfort and support, making them a great choice for both gym workouts and everyday activities. With minor tweaks to the laces and added reflectivity, they would be nearly perfect for fitness enthusiasts.
review.name: Divide 5GTX

review.itemreviewed: Divide 5 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great support and lovely cushioning. My partner loves his new runners and can’t take them off
review.name: Great Support

review.itemreviewed: Divide 5 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Started off a little tight, but have broken in nicely. Very comfortable, great grip. Stays dry in dew soaked grass.

review.itemreviewed: Divide 5 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I purchased these shoes the moment they were released because I was looking to replace my trail shoes but really wanted gortex and Brooks are my go-to in terms of comfort and fit. They definitely have not disappointed! I did what we all know is a bad idea and wore new shoes on a 10km hike and didn’t feel an ounce of discomfort. They are packed and ready to hike with me across Scotland.
review.name: Divide 5 GTX did not disappoint!!

name: Divide 5 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: I am a LEO and have tried all of the tactical brands as well as Mountain Hardware and Patagonia. Mystery Ranch has been the best and their quality is top notch. This bag fits my laptop and other edc essentials that I need with multiple pockets for organization. Wish I would’ve invested in Mystery Ranch instead of wasting money on other brands.
review.name: Perfect EDC bag

review.reviewBody: Had this for about a month now. Absolutly love it! You can fit a ton stuff in this. I use it for work, but considering buying a second one for out door use. Would make a great day pack. The only thing i dont like is how accessible the clips for the shoulder strap are. Not really an issue for me but if you work/live in a big city, it would be easy for someone to walk up behind you unclip it and run off. Again not an issue for me but something to consider. As usual great craftmanship, very well made and comfortable. Like i said considering buying another for a day pack.
review.name: Great bag!

review.reviewBody: Agret bag for day to day stuff and for travel.  Well made and thought out.  Only issue is the carry on handle slot is a little too harrow for a couple of my bags.  But, I like it.
review.name: Very versatile bag

review.reviewBody: A bit unwieldy as it won’t stand up on its own, which doesn’t sound like a pain, until it keeps falling over when trying to remove items from inside. Well constructed which is a plus.
review.name: Decent….

review.reviewBody:
I purchased this bag because I have 2 other Mystery Ranch bags that I am happy with because of their overall quality in design and materials. 
The District Pro is worth the money. The materials are quality, the design is well thought out. The size is perfect for a personal item fitting under the seat of airplanes with room for your feet to fit along with the bag. The top zip pockets both front and back are very nice to have. They are not too deep as to loose items you need to find quickly. Great for keeping keys and small wallet that holds ID and a credit card. The necessary items one needs to have quick access during travel. The front pocket has plenty of room to keep a passport for quick access. One thing I would suggest is to have a section of the back zipper pocket that has a dedicated space that is slightly deeper than the rest of the space so you can keep your passport, in the same pocket as your small wallet that holds ID and credit card. This would help with organization as well as safety since the pocket is zippered and close to the body.
Over all the bag is very good. It could be awesome with a few small tweaks.
review.name: Almost a Very Good bag !

review.reviewBody: Have had this for about 3 weeks.  Replaced a 20 year old Patagonia laptop pack.  This Mystery Ranch is better in every way.  Don’t hesitate to buy this.  Worth every penny.
review.name: Amazing buy one now

review.reviewBody:
I have been using this bag for 6 months now. Ordering it online, I was concerned on the size but it was time to transition out of my 20 year old Timbuk2. I liked the idea of the smaller fit and more true organization and the District Pro truly has it all. 
For work I have to carry my computer, cords, pens, paperwork and odds and ends. On top of that, I generally carry my personal computer, and most of the time a spare portable monitor. The bag is tight, but it fits it all. I can say I have stressed the zippers and shoulder strap pad. 
Recently, I have been taking out the organizer in the center compartment and using it for overnight travel, with a packing cube. It has room for my clothes, computer, cords, a stash pocket for snacks, keys, ear bud case, and still the hidden back pocket for my passport. 

I have several Mystery Ranch bags, from a Terraframe 65, Coullee 30, Wingman Multipocket, and District Pro. I am sure I will get a few more because I have yet to be disappointed or uncomfortable. I hope they keep up with this quality since being bought out.
review.name: This bag has become my go to for my work days.

review.reviewBody: The only thing I’m not thrilled about is the lack of room for sweatshirts
review.name: Great bag

review.reviewBody: The integrity of the bag relies on the removable divider/organizer, when it is not used (removed) there is nothing from keeping the main compartment from opening completely wide and dumping your gear on the ground. The lack of included alternate inner straps (or some other analogous system) is a big miss. I tried to use this as a camera bag but the inner divider takes up space, yet can't be removed unless I want my camera gear on the ground. Otherwise the build quality is great.
review.name: Center divider is a blessing and a curse....

review.reviewBody: I bought this bag a month ago and use it everyday. Its design inhibits the perfect amount of options without being too overdone. I use it for work to carry a laptop and large tablet plus accessories. Plenty of pockets and sleeves in just the right places.
review.name: Perfectly designed!

name: District Pro Bag

review.reviewBody: I have not used it yet b/c I bought it off season, but the jacket looks and fits great.  It has multiple pockets and has a little extra layer for warmth, I did not want just a shell.  I purchased a Medium b/c the last jacket I tried in a small (different brand) was a little tight when I moved my arms.  The medium allows me to move, but not look too big.   I look forward to using my new jacket on the slopes this winter!
review.name: Very nice looking

review.reviewBody: I first saw this jacket in-store and fell in love with the Taupe color and style.  I have traditionally skied in Arcteryx jackets so I wasn't sure how technical / warm / breathable this would be.  I have worn this jacket on the hill all January in frigid temps and I love it.  The pockets are well placed and don't add weird bulk when you carry your phone or a snack (A complaint about my other ski  jackets).  I love the slightly longer hem in the back and the color and sheen are fun and stand out. The snap closure over the chest zipper keeps out that cold blast of wind through the seams.  The jacket is warmer than I expected - I often wear just a base layer under.   I have not worn it on a a big snow / storm day yet but that will be my next test to see how it does in moisture.  Love this jacket!
review.name: Warm, Cute and Functional!

name: Ragnhild Down Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: Got this brake about a week and a half after i ordered it. Once i installed the brake i couldnt close it? so i brought the brake to a mountain bike shop for them to check it out just to realize it had two  chipped pistons. a BRAND NEW BRAKE is already broken? how does this happen? Im going to contact support and try to get a refund since it didnt work out the box ill edit the review once i start the process. Just stay away from this site from a whole.
review.name: Should've listened to the reviews

review.reviewBody: I ordered both front and rear brakes. Both arrived leaking with contaminated pads. The box for the front brake had an obvious spill. The rear brake looked fine at a glance but after removing the pads I could see oil on the back of the pads.
review.name: Arrived leaking oil, contaminated  pads

review.reviewBody: The piston seals began leaking within a couple of rides contaminating the pads and rotor.  After the brakes started squilling loudly i pulled the pads and sure enough, an oil ring the size of each piston was visable around the back side of each pad.  Shimano has an issue with piston seals so i switched brands
review.name: Leaky piston seals

review.reviewBody: They work great! Very easy to assemble. Im not sure why the 1 star review because you have to assemble. Cut the cables to fit and bleed the brakes and you're ready to go. Would recommend them to anyone.
review.name: Shimano Brakes

review.reviewBody: I order this brake expecting to receive the part with fluid ready to install, instead I received a separated caliper and brake lever, with a hose and all the parts unassembled. How can you make this right Backcountry since I will have to pay to have it assembled and bled????
review.name: You sent me parts not an assembled brake
comment: Lolooolol, all shimano brakes come like this.
This is extremely easy to do, is it not?
I'm confused.  Is competitive cyclist actually Backcountry?
This is how all Shimano brakes ship.

name: Deore BR-M6120 Disc Brake

review.reviewBody: The most comfortable Gore-tex boot I ever wore. I work in a logistics plant & we are on our feet most of our shift. Great for the current cold weather. Definitely a great purchase.
review.name: Comfort 24/7

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam X Hierro Mid Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: The shoe looks great and is very comfortable, however it is not very rugged and not intended for major trail/hiking use. I purchased this shoe to try out and perhaps switch over from my Keen Hiking boots.  This shoe did not come close to comparing.  Its nice to use around the house and maybe take to the park, but not for extreme outdoor activities.
review.name: Shoe quality.

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam X Hierro Mid Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: The shoe looks nice, and feels and appears to be of decent quality. However, there is a design flaw. Where the gusset of the tongue is stitched to join the body of the shoe, it forms a very hard spot on the upper inside, causing the corner of the tongue to dig into the foot. Both right and left shoes had the same issue in the same spot.
review.name: Extremely uncomfortable

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam X Hierro Mid Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Eeveryone complains that the shoes are too tight, that they are bad, etc. These are the best shoes I have ever had for everyday use in cold and wet weather.
the first day when I put them on, they were a little tight, but a couple of days later when I put them on for the second time they fit perfectly, thin or thick socks they are ideal, light and soft when walking on asphalt or trekking.
review.name: good shoes for everyday or trekking
