review.reviewBody: This rating is for both the glove and backcountry.  I bought a size 9 after measuring my hand multiple times and the size was way too small.  Backcountry gave me an option of exchange or return for credit.  I wanted to just return for refund and buy the size 10, so I'd get them sooner and they wouldn't sell out.  Well, they got the size 9 back and now the 10 are out of stock.  Why they don't put aside the 10 for an exchange is beyond me.  This is after chatting with a rep for a while about the options.  They were on sale as well.  Thanks backcountry.  thanks.
review.name: Sizing is way off

review.reviewBody: I can't believe what made me wait so long to have one of these. I love the material, size and the color.
review.name: Love the style, size and color!

review.reviewBody: Hestra makes really good mittens and gloves. They fit well in my usual size. Extremely well made and warm.
review.name: Hestra Army Leather Gore-tex gloves men'

review.reviewBody: I have a drawer full of gloves and mittens. I thought what the heck let’s try another pair, I have never found a warm pair of gloves until I purchased these! The leather is soft and comfortable, I even told my friends that don’t ski about these great gloves!! I have finally found a great pair of gloves! Thank you!!
review.name: Waited way to long to buy these gloves.

review.reviewBody: First pair of gloves my hands actually remained warm in freezing weather. Difficulties in fastening and unfastening outerwear while wearing these gloves. Overall well worth purchasing.
review.name: Loader

review.reviewBody:
Right out of the box, not impressed. I typically wear size xl. size 10 was the right fit.  Thought I probably spent to much. I applied the provided waterproofing to the leather. Five days later the gloves were tested. All day snowstorm in Michigan, average 25 deg. F. Total of six hours outside, 2 hour intervals doing snow removal. Fell in love with fit and comfort. 

No longer in doubt, money well spent.
Rob
review.name: Worthy

review.reviewBody: Got them for my old man and he's never been happier with a glove in all his years skiing. If anything they can get a little toasty, anything above 30 and these might be overkill. Will be purchasing a pair for myself.
review.name: Perfect for Cold/Wind

review.reviewBody: I bought these as a gift and he loves them. Said they really kept his hands nice and warm while skiing in 5° weather.
review.name: Great Gloves

review.reviewBody:
I went for the Gore-tex version of this glove thinking the extra waterproofing would help. However, it actually makes the glove worse for one very important reason.

No detachable liner. The normal Heli version of this glove has a detachable liner which achieves two things; it can be removed to be easily dried AND for the price of the Gore-tex version you can buy an extra liner to keep warm & easily swap out on the slopes.

The Gore-tex version effectively seals in any moisture that gets inside the glove and it's very difficult to thoroughly dry it out. This makes it a pain to use on back-to-back days and likely to get wet & cold on longer days.

I swapped this for the Heli 3-finger glove & an extra liner, which is warmer, nearly as waterproof when properly waxed, and much easier to dry out & clean. I highly recommend buying the normal Heli version of your choice instead (mitt, 3-finger, glove) and an extra liner that you keep stashed near your base layers for warmth.
review.name: Nice glove when dry

review.reviewBody: These are hands down the best glove my wife has found. Keeps her hands warm and dry!
review.name: Love Warmth Love

name: Army Leather GORE-TEX Glove - Men's

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable on the first wear and get better as they loosen up.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: One shoe near the tongue feels immensely uncomfortable. 0/10
review.name: Bad fit

review.reviewBody:
Good sole support and comfortable.
Only con is the high design of the back with the loop to pull on is convenient for putting them on but it rubbed above my heel in longer hikes.
review.name: Looks cool feels good

review.reviewBody: I don’t know if I would call these hiking shoes. They are more like tennis shoes with more aggressive bottom tred, but uppers are just tennis shoes. I thought they would be more wide in the toe box like all the other Keens I’ve purchased, but they’re not. I had to go up a full size for proper fitting.
review.name: Tennis shoes

review.reviewBody: Most comfortable trail shoes I’ve ever worn. They are comfortable at the arch and don’t create hotspots on the top of my foot from the laces. They could work very easily work as slip ons if they came with elastic laces. I like the height that they give me without feeling like I’m wearing lifts.
review.name: Perfect shoe?

review.reviewBody: One of the most comfortable shoes I’ve worn. Unfortunately, too wide for my foot.
review.name: Comfortable, best for wide feet

review.reviewBody: Ordered a men’s 9.5 as the women’s size 11 didn’t come in wide. The fit is perfect.
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody: Ordered the speed hiking shoe before a vacation. Had been suffering heel pain for weeks with very slow improvement. The shoes arrived the day before we left so no break in. They have been a dream! 20k steps a day and 100 floors while hiking around Cabo. Foot feels fine!
review.name: Value, comfort, and support

review.reviewBody: These are abit tight and ridgid at first compared to many new hiking shoes I've had. They are starting to be more comfortable the more I wear them. I wish the laces were a bit longer, as I have a high instep. I'm looking forward to a long relationship after I break them in.
review.name: My Zionic Speed Hiking Shoe Experience

review.reviewBody: They started falling apart after wearing for a day. Returned them.
review.name: A

name: Zionic Speed Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Just got these, they are comfortable and I love the colour. Will send another note re durability when I have a season of climbing in these pants
review.name: Women's Notion SP Pants

review.reviewBody: Perfect amount of stretch. Was hesitant about the elastic waist band, but it proved to be more effective than the usual drawstring. Love the leg pocket and it’s the perfect size for a phone. Just wish there were pockets on the butt with zippers and the front pockets were deeper
review.name: Notion SP pants

review.reviewBody: Comfortable pants , true to size , I am not crazy about the color choices. It would be nice for the company to consider offering more colors.
review.name: Pants

review.reviewBody: I really wanted to like these pants, as they seem to have good construction and I like the material. The fit just really didn't work with my body. I'm 5'9", 156 pounds, with more weight in my hips. The crotch area pulled in a very uncomfortable and unflattering way. This was the case for the medium. I also tried the size large, which fit better right out of the box, but after one wear they stretched out so much that they were sagging in a very unflattering way. Sending the medium back.
review.name: strange fit

review.reviewBody: I love the pants. Confortable, good range of motion. The color is more brown than in the pictures, but it is really nice!
review.name: Nice climbing pants

review.reviewBody: Liked the roomy for on these, but the reinforced knee area felt bulky, uncomfortable, and distracting for climbing. Returned.
review.name: Thick knee area

review.reviewBody: I’m addicted to these pants. They fit perfectly (thank to the size charts)!
review.name: Perfect fit!!

review.reviewBody: I love these pants. They are comfortable and have plenty of pockets.
review.name: Comfortable, functional

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love the fit and style of the old sp notions . Bring back the old style waistband . Would love to see more time spent on reinforcing the back pockets to prevent holes than making the wasted band where it won’t stay up .
review.name: Don’t fix what’s not broken

review.reviewBody: I have been searching for a new pair of climbing pants that are comfortable and fit well. I have owned previous versions of the notion SP pants and I really wanted to like these ones. They fit well but when I climb I find they pull down in the back a lot (which is incredibly uncomfortable). I wish the waist band had some sort of drawstring as the elastic band is a little lose on the waist.
review.name: Really wanted to love these!

name: Notion SP Pant - Women's

description: Buy the Coleman Arch Bay 15F Sleeping Bag online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Arch Bay 15F Sleeping Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Coleman Arch Bay 15F Sleeping Bag online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I😒😒 t's obvious that someone has never been outdoors. A bag of this color won't keep you warm.  This bag will only reflect the heat, you'd be lucky if it made it to 60°
review.name: Survivor56
comment:
Hello. Thank you for your feedback. The Arch Bay™ 15°F Big & Tall Sleeping Bag is designed to retain warmth through its advanced insulation materials, rather than relying on color for heat retention. We test our sleeping bags to ensure they meet their temperature ratings and provide comfort in cold conditions. If you have any concerns about its performance, please do not hesitate to let us know via our "Contact Us" website at https://www.coleman.com/support/contact-us and we’d be happy to assist further.

Thank you,
Coleman Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I live in MN so a nice warm sleeping bag is a necessity for camping. This fits my needs perfectly! I would recommend this to anyone looking for a new sleeping bag.
review.name: Great sleeping bag!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So far I really like this sleeping bag. It’s soft, warm and easy to get back in the carrier. I’ve only had a few sleeping bags in my life but this is by far the best one I’ve tried.
review.name: Great sleeping bag!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Coleman arch Bay 15ft sleeping bag is extremely plush which makes it super comfortable to sleep in. the size is a huge plus and is great for those that are tall. It is very soft and feels warm which makes it enjoyable to sleep in. I am excited to use it for camping! This has exceeded my expectations in every way and I highly recommend!
review.name: Comfortable & Warm!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] During the winter storm I use this sleeping bag to try it out and it kept me warm under the freezing temperatures. It went below zero and I didn’t feel cold plus it was very comfortable and cozy. Thank you influenster for gifting me this product I love it! And would definitely keep using it and would highly recommend for the freezing temperatures.
review.name: Great for cold temperatures!!!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This sleeping bag is so comfortable and cozy! We tried it in cold temperatures and it kept us so warm! I love the pop of color with neutrals as well. 
I received the product for free from Influenster and Coleman Arch Bay in exchange for my honest review
review.name: Super Comfortable!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am so fortunate I had this product to try out! We lost our power and consequently had no heat. Thankfully, we had this sleeping bag and it did the trick! It kept me warm and toasty until morning and I would definitely give this a try if you are thinking of camping or just to keep in case of emergencies. I will be replacing my bag with this one next time we are on one of our trips.
review.name: Kept me warm at 30 degrees

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This bag is perfect.  Not too silky.  Doesn't catch on dry skin, if youknow, you know.  Zips upwithout a fight as well.   Easy to roll up.  Usually like wrestling 3 monkeys to close them up.   No tag trim needed.  And if you're taller it's got you!  No cold shoulders sticking out !  6' 3" and fit comfortably!!!
review.name: Perfect!   This is a great sleeping bag for cold weather!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Everybody was impressed by the quality of this sleeping bag. For the price you’re getting a nice soft material that’s heavy enough to withstand low temps down to 15 degrees F. The zipper was the best part because I’m used to struggling around the corner but this zipper was durable and did not have that material in the way!!! Best design and material. We give it a 5 star review because it’s being enough for my 275 lbs husband, unfortunately is not meant for backpacking because of weight.
review.name: Solid comforter material Arch Bay sleeping bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was given an Arch Bay sleeping bag free for my honest opinion. To start with, the length is amazing! It's very soft and cozy for a sleeping bag. Nice and warm with a place for your pillow! We've used it a few times now and still feels brand new. The colors are so vibrant! It's a 10 out of 10 for our family
review.name: Warm and soft

name: Arch Bay 15F Sleeping Bag

hasVariant.name: Flex 4 Cooking System
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Flex 4 Cooking System online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I bought this set about 10 years ago for family camping and hunting trips. On day one I added the MSR frying pan and four collapsible MSR sporks. The Sporks fit nicely into each cup and the frying pan nestles nicely on the large pot to make one entire enclosed unit. I do put a napkin as a layer between the large pot and frying pan. So far I have only used the large pot to store food items that I don’t want birds or rodents to get into like coffee, chips, and snacks once we setup camp. 

I only gave this system 4 stars because the cups are not insulted, the metal will burn your lips, and the cups can be too hot to handle with boiling water in warm temperatures. The frying pan , when used in cold temperatures, will buckle in the center when using a small diameter heat source but it does seem to buckle back into its shape. Unfortunately, I couldn’t find sporks that matched the color pattern perfectly but that doesn’t matter as it did not come with the set. However, MSR must have thought about the overall dimensions when used with this set. 

I would highly recommend this and pair it nicely with MSR kitchen bag where you can store spatulas, knife, soap, oil, msr cutting board, msr salt and pepper shaker and pietro lighter.
review.name: 10+ years and still going strong

review.reviewBody: everything is perfect but, i wish the cups were in stainless steel like they used to be.
review.name: amazing

review.reviewBody: I guide and this set is perfect for my groups small and large. Very versatile and functional. I use it frequently!
review.name: The standard for group kits!

review.reviewBody: Does not include frypan.worth getting and integrated into set seamlessly.MSR thinks ahead.that’s one of the reasons we love their products.keep on thinking. Tony
review.name: Frypan

review.reviewBody: I purchased this set a few years ago and it works great. The set nests really well saving pack space and I found that it has room to fit the MSR quick skillet in side it as well. The deep plates keep food from slipping off your plate while eating in a rugged site where tables are not to be found.
review.name: Great Set

review.reviewBody: Free! Get up To An Extra 20% OFF Coupons from coupon-bird. com (No space)
review.name: Brilliant!

review.reviewBody: Unable to clean it fully, I purchased the MSR scrubber with hopes that it would help clean it, but this was unsuccessful, i loved the weight of this item.
review.name: Unable to clean it fully,

review.reviewBody: Our family of 4 has used this kit for a couple of years camping and it has been great. We love that it stacks up so we don't have random plates, mugs etc floating around our action packers. They're also light and have have held up well in terms of durability. We camp approximately 4 times/year for a few days each time and use this set for every meal.
review.name: Great for our family

review.reviewBody: I've had this set for a while and really enjoy it. I like to cook real food when I'm on an adventure and this kit allows me to do just that. Don't have 4 people? Save some weight and leave behind what you don't need.
review.name: I LOVE this set for kayak trips

review.reviewBody: Not a backpacking set up. Better utilised as a Basecamp set with big groups. Pots are huge.
review.name: Invite everyone to the party!

name: Flex 4 Cooking System

review.itemreviewed: Aioks All In One Kitchen System
review.reviewBody:
I am someone who likes to cook outdoors, and I bought this to compliment my overland camping setup since it seemed like a really good fit with the rest of my gear. 
   However, once I actually took it out for use in the wild, that is when I realized several things I do not like:
   1. The 2 burner attached to the unit is too close to each other, and not strong enough for me. It might be strong enough for some, but I've tried cooking stew, steak, and some stir fry dishes on a normal 10' pots/pan but took way longer than my 7000 BTU burner I bought from Amazon as a backup for $30 (which I ended up using as a primary since this took too long).
   2. The support legs for the wooden top extension are not very sturdy, and the clamp mechanism for adjusting and locking does not sustain much weight before it needs to be re-adjusted, which can be a bit annoying. 
   3. Storage compartment inside could be better if it had some kind of damper layer made of silicone or rubber. Anything solid you put inside here will make lots of noise if you are off-roading, and although this can be fixed with careful placement and additional bagging, it is a bit annoying to be dealing with.
   4. I voiced my concern with backcountry.com, but because I was right outside the 30 day RMA policy by few days, they could not do anything for me (which is my issue but still putting it out here since my sodium level is a bit high at the moment, and this will probably be the last time I use backcountry.com for any purchase)
   Overall, if any of my complaints/issues I have with the product seems a bit trivial and does not concern you, then I think it could serve your needs very well in the outdoors. However, for me it was too expensive for what it actually offered ($400 USD before tax), and I cannot say that I can recommend this product to anyone who prioritizes cooktop BTU strength, spacing/placement of your cooktop, the sturdiness of the support legs, and the lack of damper inside the storage compartment.
review.name: Good In Theory, Not Practical IRL

review.itemreviewed: Aioks All In One Kitchen System
review.reviewBody: I have been eyeing this for years and was so excited to finally pull the plug on this purchase. For the price, I was expecting a high quality product, but one side of the box has sharp edges. Dangerous if you slip while loading it onto the van.
review.name: Sharp edges

name: Aioks All In One Kitchen System

review.reviewBody: I usually wear a size large in pants, *occasionally* sizing up to an XL, but with these I ended up returning the XL and keeping the XXL. Don't let the XXL fool you - these aren't exactly size inclusive. I hate that there is no standard for women's clothing sizes, and it only seems to get worse in the cycling apparel industry. I have an athletic build with big strong thighs, and some days I do wonder if I'm going to hulk out of these. It feels like these were designed for someone with a small, very straight figure before they were arbitrarily sized up. They aren't super great for curves, but they feel like they fit, and I have gotten several compliments, but these could stand to be roomier for normal curves. On a positive note, I do love how lightweight these are - they're great for summer mountain biking. These do NOT have a liner, which I didn't initially love (especially for the price), but I have come to appreciate. I will probably pick up another pair of these in a different color, but I would love to see a slight redesign of this style.
review.name: Runs SMALL!

review.reviewBody: Bought these 3 weeks ago and have worn several times!  I’m 5’6”, 145-150 lbs w/ an athletic build and got a large for liners to be able to fit underneath.  I have been looking for shorts with vents and these do - so great!  I probably could have worn a medium as they are relaxed through the butt/hips but I was so excited to find these BC shorts I kept them. Even on sale!  Great material, washes beautifully and dry quickly.  I Will use these for bike and hiking.  My daughter even bought a pair after she saw them!
review.name: Excellent “hot weather” MTB shorts!

review.reviewBody: These are a nice material and fit (though they seem to run a little small so size up if you order) but the pocket placement is a big bummer. No side pockets, only front pockets, I definitely couldn't put anything useful in the pockets while riding. I like to be able to go on short rides with no pack, I rely on my pockets, so I returned these.
review.name: Poor pocket placement, nice material

review.reviewBody:
Love these shorts! They fit well and are flattering. They are higher waisted than some of the other shorts I tried on which I like. They have a little belt you can adjust but they are pretty snug on me already. The only slightly weird thing about them is they have lots and lots of holes for breathability which are a little awkward if you don't wear a chamois underneath.

I'll buy more when they come out with more colors.
review.name: Cute and comfy

review.reviewBody: I’m a true medium and couldn’t not even get these to button. It seems every year they redesign these shorts and they get smaller. Nice material and better clasp than years past, but size up.
review.name: Runs very small

review.reviewBody:
I love these shorts. Except not for me. Not purchase every time. 

I have tried this same style on on three seasons in a row, hoping the fit would change. I love everything everything about them, except for the fit on me. I’ve never bought a pair bc they aren’t right. 
Fabric (lightweight, stretchy, seemingly durable) and design are so awesome. 
Fit: more for someone with hourglass figure. The waist is too tight, or the hips are too large. 
@Backcountry: could you make same short  with alternative fits?
review.name: I want these to work

review.reviewBody: These are the lightest and most comfortable pair of mountain bike shorts I have ever owned. Will be buying them in other colors. Sizing was perfect
review.name: lightweight

review.reviewBody: These are cute shorts and fit well. But when riding, they ride up your leg and bunch up. So not comfortable. I hate to send them back, but I can't ride with shorts like this.
review.name: Ride Up

review.reviewBody: The Small feels like an XS. Definity size up in this size, but the material isn't as nice as the 11" version, there isn't as much strech/give to the fabric when moving your legs around. Will be returning.
review.name: Runs Small

review.reviewBody: I love these shorts.  They are the best of the summer!  I love the colors - I get compliments on all of them.  Yes I said "all of them" because I have bought three pairs, and now plan to go buy the other two I didn't buy yet.  I love the pockets, my phone and small wallet and keys fit!  And when they are zipped, the shorts look sleek.  I mostly wear these shorts for Pickleball, and I also ride Mountain Bike, hike, boat, kayak.  These are great for all activities.  I read another review of someone that matches my size and she found they didn't fit her.  I bought size L (I'm 5-10 and weigh roughly 165).  yes they are tight around the waist but hey I need to drop a couple of pounds and it doesn't impact the comfort.  I was hesitant at first because of the little bumps they put in the back but I've not even noticed them.
review.name: These are great shorts I love them!

name: Slickrock 9in Bike Short - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Zip Wedge Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Was hoping these would be as comfy as the Joan of Arc wedge waterproof boots I bought years ago…unfortunately they are more of a wear out to dinner shoe not an all day/night shoe. They are stylish
review.name: Style more than comfort with this wedge boot
comment: Oh no! We'd love to hear more about your thoughts on our shoes. Please contact our Customer Care team so we can get to the bottom of what wasn't so great about your experience.

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Zip Wedge Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Edgy and cute. I didn't think these would be as comfortable as they are. Love them with tights and a dress.
review.name: A YES for me

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Zip Wedge Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Super cute, sturdy, and well-constructed. Loved them so much I bought a second pair (white/black). My only minor complaint is that, since the neck of the boot is a little higher than the Joan boots I'm used to, the top rubs into my legs a bit which is uncomfortable. Hoping this stops once I break them in a bit. All in all I love them!
review.name: Great boots!

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Zip Wedge Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Sorel never disappoints. I have 4 pairs of their boots and all of them are so comfortable and uniquely stylish. Everyone asks me where I got my boots. I can’t wait for my next pair!
review.name: Sorel rocks!

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Zip Wedge Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Perfect fit and very stylish with pants or skirts. High quality!
review.name: Delightful

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Zip Wedge Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These boots were exactly what I was looking for. Waterproof, lightweight wedges.
review.name: Lightweight wedges!

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Zip Wedge Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I loved these boots when they arrived. They were very slightly tighter than usual over the top of my foot, but I figured they would stretch out a bit or I could wear a thinner sock. I wore them out a couple of times, and they were pretty comfortable. Not quite as comfortable as previous Sorels, but still OK. A few days ago, I wore them to work all day, and later discovered these pretty bad abrasions on my legs. The area also feels a bit bruised a day later. I've never experienced anything like this before. I don't have large legs, in fact, I'm pretty small-boned, so I can't figure out why this happened.
review.name: Look fantastic, but left marks and bruises
comment: Oh no! We'd love to hear more about your thoughts on our shoes. Please contact our Customer Care team so we can get to the bottom of what wasn't so great about your experience.

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Zip Wedge Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These are super cute and are pretty comfy as long as you have the right socks on.
review.name: So far so good!

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Zip Wedge Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Please bring back the old wedge Style. This new wedge is terrible on the forefoot . It is painful. The old wedge was a great shoe. I am a surgeon. I could stand in it all day and operate it all day. I don’t know whySorel got rid of the wedge styles shoes that were last year the year before styles. Please bring them back.
review.name: Painful
comment: Hello Orthosurgeon23, we appreciate you sharing your feedback and we're sorry ONA AVE™ Women's Zip Wedge didn't meet your standards. We will inform our product team of your concerns and ensure this is fixed for the future.

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Zip Wedge Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Excellent and comfortable boots, perfect for fall.
review.name: Comfortable Fall Boots

review.reviewBody:
I like this hat for its sturdiness and perfect size brim. 
My head size is 23” and the M fits perfect.
review.name: Great hat.

review.reviewBody: I purchased this hat for my husband‘s birthday. He needed a sun hat for our upcoming Florida trip. The hat is a very cute but it was shipped in a bag and was completely smashed when I received it. Little pieces of hat fell out of the bag. So I do not recommend buying this hat, even if it ships in a box it doesn’t seem like it would hold up well.
review.name: Cute hat, but falls apart easily

review.reviewBody: Well made, and if it fits you, it's a good buy. At 23 3/8 inches I'm on the border between L and XL. I went for an L because my head circumference fell in the range. But surprisingly the hat dropped right onto my ears when I put it on. In fact, I could have tucked my ears inside of it. I used the little sizing tab in the back of the to make it fit, but could not figure out how to make it stay in place. After a minute or so, the hat just relaxed back to its original size. I had to send it back. Also, I was offered free shipping under the sale terms when I bought it, but was charged for shipping anyway. Then shipping was also deducted from my return as well as sales tax. Only the price of the hat was credited back. It was a costly order to end up with nothing.
review.name: Big Hat

review.reviewBody: My husband loves his new hat. He has trouble finding hats that fit him because his head is big and the large is perfect for him. Definitely recommend!
review.name: Great hat for a guy with a giant melon.

review.reviewBody: Another great hat in my repertoire of Sunday afternoon. Excellent sun protection with a nice look and comfortable fit. Medium fits a 7 3/8 head in ball caps.
review.name: Perfect sun hat

review.reviewBody: Love the hat but I left it in the back of my car and my dog stepped on it. Destroyed.
review.name: Great but.

review.reviewBody: Lightweight sun protection, breathable an stylish, my husband loves this hat!
review.name: My husband looks great in this hat!

review.reviewBody: Great shape and very sturdy. Runs a little small but opening the seam in the band works to give a little more room. I love my new hat. Stylish, too.
review.name: Leisure Hat

review.reviewBody: I love this hat! It is stylish and cool and fits my need perfectly! I was between a M and L and went with the L. Glad I did, becasue the internal adustments make it fit perfectly without being tight/hot. I have worn it hiking around Wormsloe, to an art show, the farmer's market, and an all day air show! Love my new hat!
review.name: Great hat!

name: Leisure Hat

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam X Hierro Mid Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I do a lot of trail walking and these are comfortable and give me that additional ankle support I want.  Also the sale price for this shoe is great!
review.name: Have 2 Pair!

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam X Hierro Mid Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Really comfy, width is fine (I sized up 1 size). Supportive around the ankle. Like the foam sole. Good to use recycled materials.
review.name: Cool shoe for walking

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam X Hierro Mid Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These walking boots are so comfortable, stylish and keep my feet warm and dry in the rain
review.name: Great Walking Boots

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam X Hierro Mid Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Light and comfortable hiking shoes. Got these before a trip to the Lake District and wore them straight away. Waterproof held up again the rain and surface water. Only slight downside is the front leather is scuffed already after only a week of wear.
review.name: Comfortable lightweight waterproof hiking shoes
comment: Thank you for your feedback! We’re delighted to hear that your Fresh Foam X Hierro Mid Gore-Tex® are comfortable and performed well in the rain during your trip to the Lake District. We’re sorry to learn about the scuffing on the leather after just a week of wear. We appreciate your input and would love to assist you further if you have any concerns. We are here to help!

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam X Hierro Mid Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These were comfortable however II returned the shoes because the laces were on the short side.
review.name: Laces too short
comment: We appreciate your feedback on our Fresh Foam X Hierro Mid Gore-Tex® and regret to hear that the laces were not long enough for your needs. At New Balance, we strive to offer high-quality functional products, and your feedback helps us enhance our product design.

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam X Hierro Mid Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Got a pair for my birthday last year. The most comfortable and secure grip I’ve ever had. Only negative - they were not as sturdy, after 600km of walking (it took me 9 months), they started to fall apart on the seams. Real shame. My husband wanted to submit a complaint because the product meant to last longer than that. I want another pair, but am worried about longevity.
review.name: Amazing trainers, don’t last long…

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam X Hierro Mid Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I don't know why but it's not comfortable at all and I 'm not happy with these shoes.
review.name: Poor
comment: Thank you for your comment and feedback. We’re sorry to hear that you’re not satisfied with the comfort of the Fresh Foam X Hierro Mid Gore-Tex®. Your satisfaction is our priority. We’re here to help you, and would love to find an alternative that better suits your needs and preferences in terms of comfort. Please, do not hesitate to contact our customer care team!

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam X Hierro Mid Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Lovely comfortable trainers, sized up by a half, fabric seems water repellent so better than expected and easier to keep clean.
review.name: Walking on air

name: Fresh Foam X Hierro Mid Wide Hiking Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: Very impressed with how confident I feel climbing in these and the weight penalty is small for long days of climbing. On my third pair.
review.name: Super light weight and climb well

review.reviewBody: The tongue is gusseted but lacks enough stretchability (or extra folded fabric) to get the shoe on without.  If you can get it on without ripping it, the shoe fits very long and very narrow.  The shoe very lightweight and packable, but it is nearly impossible to get on.  Black Diamond Missions are a better alternative.
review.name: New "evo" version is awful

review.reviewBody:
Having worn the original TX2's for several years, I was interested to see what the new updates would be like. I'm very happy with the full knit sock style upper. It breathes extremely well and is very comfortable. You can loosely tie the laces and the shoe still functions while being able to slip on and off, perfect for jumping between climbs at the crag. 

I also use this shoe for long days scrambling on easier terrain, which is where it really excels in my opinion. Great sticky rubber and supportive sole for sustained time on rock.
review.name: Do It All Approach Shoe!

name: TX2 Evo Approach Shoe - Men's

I do have really large calves for a woman, so the bottom is a little snug on my gargantuan calves, but what can I do.  I recommend.

review.reviewBody:
These feel solidly made, with nice quality fabric.  Passed first ride test of 2 hours of gravel riding very comfortably, when I can get uncomfortable on that bike w the bumps of gravel in my other best and more expensive shorts.  Waist is lower than some but was comfortable on ride and shouldnt be an issue.
Also 5 stars to customer service here for being very helpful, as I did have to exchange sizes. These ran true to usual size but I ordered up after another brand ran super small...

review.itemreviewed: Rugged Flex Rigby Cargo 11in Short - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Nice fit and feel while new and these shorts continually impress me.  Comfortable, decent looking and well (enough) appointed.

Good pocket coverage with a really good phone pocket.  One complaint on pockets is the lack of reinforcement for a pocket knife in the front pockets that other Carhartt shorts have. This is a big miss.  And lowers it to a 4.5.

Wish there was a size 37.

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Let me start off by saying that I ultimately do quite like this product, and I can recommend it if you're in need of a good portable cooking pot. However I do feel that it could definitely be better, and it falls short in a few ways (especially considering the price).

Out of the box, this feels and looks high-quality. Most of the body is stainless steel with only the middle section being silicon - this gives it a more premium feel than I was expecting. It's easy to collapse and expand the pot, I really love the portability aspect which works as well as I hoped. And I have no issues cooking in it, it heats up fairly quickly and works perfectly on both gas and induction. There's a lot of usability here, and not just for outdoor activities. If you have a small kitchen like I do, this thing really comes in handy. 

Now here come the cons. First of all, the locking handles (which lock the lid in place) are just terrible. They are extremely finicky, making them difficult to lock and unlock, they don't want to wiggle out of place and they tend to get stuck. They're small and poorly-made, and I don't like how they completely detach from the pot, I wish there was a place to keep them when not in use. Also, the design of the lid is also odd, it's only *very slightly* wider than the mouth of the pot, so it's difficult to get a tight seal since you have to line it up perfectly. If it were just a half-inch wider this wouldn't be an issue. 

But here's my main gripe: the stainless steel is not very stainless! Anybody who's familiar with SS knows that the material can stain (with hard water/mineral buildup/etc, I'm not sure what the exact term is but you know what I mean, those white/clear spots that develop on SS cutlery) especially if you don't dry it quickly after washing it. But this pot just takes that to a whole other level. After my first time using it, literally the entire bottom of the inside is covered in water spots. And it's difficult to remove, even with my tried-and-true cleaning methods! Again I'm very familiar with SS, I cook in it all the time, but this is just too much. I have never owned a SS pot that has discolored this quickly. I don't know what the issue is, are they using a cheap material or what? But it's very frustrating and makes me less likely to use this pot over others. 

All-in-all, I love the idea here and this thing really comes in handy. Perfect for camping, small spaces etc. But I hope the company goes back to the drawing board and tweaks some of the issues on display here (lousy lid and handles/stainless steel that's very prone to discoloration). I can still recommend it, as I said, but these issues bring down an otherwise great product, and I expect more considering the premium price tag.
review.name: Great concept, mixed execution

name: Detour Stainless Steel Collapsible 3L Pot
